title: People who always vote no and a possible fix to the surrender system
body:
Recently I've been put in a team with your typical duo, those ones who feed all game and start blaming the mid laner or the jungler for not ganking their lane (that THEY already lost 5 minutes into the game) enough. 
As the jungler, as much as they annoy me, I try to avoid flaming them (mainly because I am in Bronze and sometimes feed too).
What pisses me off though is when they decide that a game with the whole enemy team fed (by them), is somehow winnable and choose to vote no whenever a surrender vote pops up. 
Clearly, the 3 other people in the team (including me) aren't having fun, all we wanted was for this game to be over and play the next one.
They do not realise that by voting no, they are turning a 20 minute game into a full 40 minute game wasting other people's time. They start flaming after a while too.

NOTE: IT WAS A NORMAL GAME. NOT RANKED.

The current surrender system is flawed in my opinion. Here's a simple and possible fix: after having 3 YES' and 2 NO's 3 or 4 times, the game ends.

Example:
Surrender vote failed for your team 3/2
Surrender vote failed for your team 3/2
Surrender vote failed for your team 3/2
few moments later...
Ally team agreed to surrender

I really hope they do something about this. Sorry about the bad English.

replies.body:
So in other words, end the game at 30 instead of 40?

And while in normals you have a small point, because everyone surrenders normals it means you don't learn the late game capability's of your champions so that you can pull comebacks out of longer games.

That's the duo in the wrong, not the system itself.

"So in other words, end the game at 30 instead of 40?"
Ending a pointless, unwinnable game 10 minutes earlier? that's good enough.
Those 10 minutes could save you hours after months of playing.

"you don't learn the late game capability's of your champions so that you can pull comebacks out of longer games."
I think I've played Lee Sin enough to know what it's like with him late game.

"That's the duo in the wrong, not the system itself."
To me it's them abusing something that's wrong with the system. I've never met someone who disagreed with their duo (when choosing between Y/N).
Lee Sin doesn't have a late game, perhaps try playing a champion that does, instead of one that loses if the game goes over 18 minutes.

I don't know how this relates to the topic but. Yes, Lee Sin isn't very good late game. I play him for FUN so do most people I know. Pulling off those sick combos or inSecs to me is very satisfying especially when it results in your team winning. 

For example: me kicking a Sejuani that's 2 levels up away from Baron so she couldn't smite it. Simple things like that
If it is a 40 Min game then either team can win, and I'd say the odds would be in your favour because the other team have not been able to close the game even though they dominated early game.
I fight games to the bitter end and never surrender no matter what, even the idea of surrendering makes me sick.
